content: little loon a symbol of northern wilderness and the great lakes of north america this water bird is knit in the round tail to beak with no seams minimal colorwork and short row gauge is not important but you ll need to use a yarn and needle size combination to achieve a tight enough fabric for stuffing i used 2 ply fingering yarn held double worsted could also work the yardage referenced below should be half with size 4 3 5mm needles i made a mini sized loon using fingering yarn and size 1 2 25mm needles needles us size 4 3 5mm dpns or circs yarn knitpicks palette held double black bittersweet heather 28 yds white bare/undyed 10yds optional grey marble heather 1yd additional materials stuffing material polyfil or yarn scraps darning needle red beads 6mm abbreviations st s stitch es k knit p purl magic_ring make a right-leaning stitch lift the bar between stitches onto the left needle back to front then knit into the front of the stitch ml make a left-leaning stitch lift the bar between stitches onto the left needle front to back then knit into the back of the stitch k2tog knit two stitches together through the front a right-leaning decrease ssk slip slip knit a left-leaning decrease slip one stitch knitwise then a second stitch knitwise place both stitches back on left needle and knit together through the back loop i prefer to only slip the first stitch knitwise w&t wrap and turn i prefer the twinned or shadow wrap method tutorial here https //brooklyntweed com/pages/how-to-knit-shadow-wrap-short-row-video-tutorial cdd center double decrease slip two stitches together knitwise knit the next stitch from the left needle then pass the slipped stitches over the one that was knitted note when designing this pattern i separated my stitches into top/back and bottom/belly as i knit using a long set of circulars for the magic loop method but a similar arrangement can be done using double pointed needles i ve included a table on the last page that shows
